crypto.crypto_generateKeyPair(private_key)[source]

Generates ECDH public key starting from random private key (local secret). The public key can be sent to the remote host to generate the shared secret. It uses NIST K-163 elliptic curve.

Parameters

private_key_8 (Numpy array of uint8) – input private key (call method crypto_privateKeySize for getting the length, i.e. 24 bytes)

Returns

ECDH public key (call method crypto_publicKeySize for getting the length, i.e. 48 bytes)

Return type

Numpy array of uint8

crypto.crypto_pkcs7pad(data)[source]

Performs padding from input data in order to respect AES standard chunk size (16 bytes) according to PKCS7 padding from RFC2315. Note: this implemention is not allined with C one; mind that C function takes a C-like string as input with the last character that is ‘/0’, for this reason the padding result is different comparing the two languages.

Parameters

data (Numpy array of uint8) – input Numpy array

Returns

padded data as Numpy array

Return type

uint8 Numpy array

crypto.crypto_sign(local_private_key, remote_public_key, data)[source]

Computes the digital signature of input data using ECDH algorithm. The private key is integer value chosen by the local user to multiply the generator point of ECC. The public key is the point generate by the remote user multipling the generator point of ECC by its secret integer value. The signature is computed applying AES encryption to the input data with the ashared key computed multiplying the private and public key in ECC domain using ECDH Diffie - Hellman algoritm.

Parameters

  • local_private_key (Numpy array of uint8) – local private key as Numpy array of 24 unsigned integer values

  • remote_public_key (Numpy array of uint8) – remote public key as Numpy array of 48 unsigned integer values

  • data (Numpy array of uint8) – input data to be signed

Returns

digital signature (padded input data size)

Return type

Numpy array of uint8

crypto.crypto_unsign(local_private_key, remote_public_key, signature)[source]

Verifies the digital signature of input data using ECDH algorithm. The private key is integer value chosen by the local user to multiply the generator point of ECC. The public key is the point generate by the remote user multipling the generator point of ECC by its secret integer value. The signature is computed applying AES encryption to the input data with the ashared key computed multiplying the private and public key in ECC domain using ECDH Diffie - Hellman algoritm.

Parameters

  • local_private_key (Numpy array of uint8) – local private key as Numpy array of 24 unsigned integer values

  • remote_public_key (Numpy array of uint8) – remote public key as Numpy array of 48 unsigned integer values

  • signature (Numpy array of uint8) – signature to be verified (padded size)

Returns

decrypted data to be verified

Return type

Numpy array of uint8
